title: Fireside Prop Pack
description: A collection of fireplace objects and props in several styles to add a source of warmth to your scene.
longDescription:
Usage Guide: blog.leapinteractive.co.uk/2016/04/fireside-props-pack-usage-guide.html

A collection of fireplace objects and props to add a source of warmth to your scene.

A choice of fireplace surrounds in multiple materials, along with the associated props to complete the setting. Add a wood burner, scuttle and tools as well as wood for fuel. A selection of material instances is included for the items, covering different construction materials as well as user-controlled levels of age and dirt.

• Stone-build fireplace in natural stone, sandstone and slate finishes.
• Marble decorative fireplace in white and dark marble.
• Brickwork fireplace recess as an optional add-on for the stone fireplace.
• Iron wood burner with a choice of modular flue pipe attachments.
• Iron grate to fit inside the fireplace.
• Country-style iron fret and modern metallic fret in a number of metal finishes.
• Coal/wood scuttle in a number of body and handle finishes.
• Fire iron stand set featuring poker, brush, scraper and shovel in a number of finishes.
• Four log pieces in new, glowing ember and ashen material variations.
• Ash pile object for placing under burnt or burning logs.

The dirt colour and amount and dirt and age of all the scene and prop items can be modified with simple controls within the material instances.
technicalDetails:
All the objects are provided as Static Mesh objects with a default material applied. They can be dragged or otherwise placed in the scene in any standard actor type. Any of the material instances can be dragged on to the mesh for an alternative and new material instances can be created with any user changes. The material instance previews feature the mesh they were intended for.
All items use real-world sizes and scaling to ensure they fit in the vast majority of situations.
All UVs are unique in 0-1 space, so that they don't require additional UVs for lighting or effects. Lightmap resolution is set fairly high by default for quality, but the user is free to modify this as it should cause no ill-effects on the objects or scene.

Props scaled to Epic skeleton: Yes
Physically-based rendering: Yes
Collision: Yes, auto-generated
Vertex count: Smallest - 58, largest - 3,910
LODs: 0
Number of meshes: 17
Number of materials: 13 materials, 50 material instances, 1 material function
Number of Textures: 45
Texture Resolution (complete list): 5 * 1024x1024, 21 * 2048x2048, 19 * 4096x4096
Intended Platform: Desktop
Platforms Tested: Desktop
Documentation Included: Yes - 'FiresideProps - Asset pack Usage Guide.doc'
